org.firebirdsql.gds.ng.fields

Class FieldValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firebirdsql.gds.ng.fields.FieldValue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, FieldDataProvider

    public final class FieldValue
extends java.lang.Object
implements FieldDataProvider, java.lang.Cloneable
    Holder object for the value of a (statement) parameter or result set field.
    Since:
    3.0
    Author:
    Mark Rotteveel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FieldValue()
      Creates an uninitialized FieldValue instance.
      FieldValue(byte[] fieldData)
      Creates an initialized FieldValue instance with the supplied fieldData.

      • FieldValue

        public FieldValue(byte[] fieldData)
        Creates an initialized FieldValue instance with the supplied fieldData.
        Parameters:
        fieldData - Byte array with the value encoded as required by the type described in fieldDescriptor

    • Method Detail

      • getFieldData

        public byte[] getFieldData()
        Description copied from interface: FieldDataProvider
        Get raw content of the filed. This method returns the array of bytes sent by the server back.
        Specified by:
        getFieldData in interface FieldDataProvider
        Returns:
        contents of the field or null if NULL value was sent from the server.

      • setFieldData

        public void setFieldData(byte[] fieldData)
        Description copied from interface: FieldDataProvider
        Set raw content of the field.
        Specified by:
        setFieldData in interface FieldDataProvider
        Parameters:
        fieldData - raw content of the field.

      • getCachedObject

        public java.lang.Object getCachedObject()
        Returns:
        Cached object

      • setCachedObject

        public void setCachedObject(java.lang.Object cachedObject)
        Stores a cached object in this field.

        This is mostly used to store blob data for batched execution.

        Parameters:
        cachedObject - Object to cache

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Is this field in an initialized state (meaning: was it explicitly set to a value (or null)).
        Returns:
        true if initialized, false otherwise

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this field to an uninitialized state.

      • clone

        public FieldValue clone()
        Clones this FieldValue instance.

        The contained field data is cloned as well, but the cached object is identical.

        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Clone of this instance
